intro: Syngramma angusta, commonly known as the narrow-leaf syngramma, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
